etymology.description: semantic: 貝 (‘cowry; money’) + phonetic: 弗
etymology.interpretation: 貝 points to the semantic field of money and valuables, fitting meanings like fees and expenses. 弗 supplies the sound, and over time the graph came to cover spending and the idea of being costly.
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 费 by streamlining strokes, effectively retaining the phonetic 弗 and using the simplified 貝 component (贝) to reduce complexity.

examples.chinese: 这次报销的费用太高(這次報銷的費用太高)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì bàoxiāo de fèiyòng tài gāo.
examples.english: The reimbursable expenses this time are too high.

examples.chinese: 学校每学期都要交学费(學校每學期都要交學費)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào měi xuéqī dōu yào jiāo xuéfèi.
examples.english: The school requires tuition to be paid every semester.

examples.chinese: 这台空调很费电，少开一会儿吧(這臺空調很費電，少開一會兒吧)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tái kòngtiáo hěn fèidiàn, shǎo kāi yíhuìr ba.
examples.english: This air conditioner uses a lot of electricity; let’s run it a bit less.
